13  package net.sf.oval.internal.util;
14  
15  import static net.sf.oval.Validator.getCollectionFactory;
16  
17  import java.util.Collection;
18  import java.util.Iterator;
19  import java.util.List;
20  import java.util.ListIterator;
21  import java.util.Set;
22  
23  /**
24   *  @author Sebastian Thomschke
25   */
26  public class LinkedSet<E> implements Cloneable, Set<E>, List<E>
27  {
28  	private final List<E> list;
29  
30  	/**
31  	 * Constructs a new, empty collection with an initial capacity (16).
32  	 */
33  	public LinkedSet()
34  	{
35  		list = getCollectionFactory().createList(16);
36  	}
37  
38  	/**
39  	 * Constructs a new, empty collection with the given initial capacity.
40  	 *
41  	 * @param initialCapacity the initial capacity
42  	 */
43  	public LinkedSet(final int initialCapacity)
44  	{
45  		list = getCollectionFactory().createList(initialCapacity);
46  	}
47  
48  	/**
49  	 * {@inheritDoc}
50  	 */
51  	public boolean add(final E e)
52  	{
53  		return list.add(e);
54  	}
55  
56  	/**
57  	 * {@inheritDoc}
58  	 */
59  	public void add(final int index, final E e)
60  	{
61  		if (!list.contains(e))
62  		{
63  			list.add(index, e);
64  		}
65  	}
66  
67  	/**
68  	 * {@inheritDoc}
69  	 */
70  	public boolean addAll(final Collection< ? extends E> c)
71  	{
72  		boolean itemAdded = false;
73  		for (final E o : c)
74  		{
75  			if (!list.contains(o))
76  			{
77  				add(o);
78  				itemAdded = true;
79  			}
80  		}
81  		return itemAdded;
82  	}
83  
84  	/**
85  	 * {@inheritDoc}
86  	 */
87  	public boolean addAll(final int index, final Collection< ? extends E> c)
88  	{
89  		final List<E> tmp = getCollectionFactory().createList(c.size());
90  		for (final E o : c)
91  		{
92  			if (!list.contains(o))
93  			{
94  				tmp.add(o);
95  			}
96  		}
97  		return list.addAll(index, tmp);
98  	}
99  
100 	/**
101 	 * {@inheritDoc}
102 	 */
103 	public void clear()
104 	{
105 		list.clear();
106 	}
107 
108 	/**
109 	 * {@inheritDoc}
110 	 */
111 	@Override
112 	public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException
113 	{
114 		@SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
115 		final LinkedSet<E> os = (LinkedSet<E>) super.clone();
116 		os.list.addAll(list);
117 		return os;
118 	}
119 
120 	/**
121 	 * {@inheritDoc}
122 	 */
123 	public boolean contains(final Object o)
124 	{
125 		return list.contains(o);
126 	}
127 
128 	/**
129 	 * {@inheritDoc}
130 	 */
131 	public boolean containsAll(final Collection< ? > c)
132 	{
133 		return list.containsAll(c);
134 	}
135 
136 	/**
137 	 * {@inheritDoc}
138 	 */
139 	@Override
140 	public boolean equals(final Object obj)
141 	{
142 		if (this == obj) return true;
143 		if (obj == null) return false;
144 		if (getClass() != obj.getClass()) return false;
145 		@SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
146 		final LinkedSet other = (LinkedSet) obj;
147 		if (list == null)
148 		{
149 			if (other.list != null) return false;
150 		}
151 		else if (!list.equals(other.list)) return false;
152 		return true;
153 	}
154 
155 	/**
156 	 * {@inheritDoc}
157 	 */
158 	public E get(final int index)
159 	{
160 		return list.get(index);
161 	}
162 
163 	/**
164 	 * {@inheritDoc}
165 	 */
166 	@Override
167 	public int hashCode()
168 	{
169 		final int prime = 31;
170 		int result = 1;
171 		result = prime * result + (list == null ? 0 : list.hashCode());
172 		return result;
173 	}
174 
175 	/**
176 	 * {@inheritDoc}
177 	 */
178 	public int indexOf(final Object o)
179 	{
180 		return list.indexOf(o);
181 	}
182 
183 	/**
184 	 * {@inheritDoc}
185 	 */
186 	public boolean isEmpty()
187 	{
188 		return list.isEmpty();
189 	}
190 
191 	/**
192 	 * {@inheritDoc}
193 	 */
194 	public Iterator<E> iterator()
195 	{
196 		return list.iterator();
197 	}
198 
199 	/**
200 	 * {@inheritDoc}
201 	 */
202 	public int lastIndexOf(final Object o)
203 	{
204 		return list.lastIndexOf(o);
205 	}
206 
207 	/**
208 	 * {@inheritDoc}
209 	 */
210 	public ListIterator<E> listIterator()
211 	{
212 		return list.listIterator();
213 	}
214 
215 	/**
216 	 * {@inheritDoc}
217 	 */
218 	public ListIterator<E> listIterator(final int index)
219 	{
220 		return list.listIterator(index);
221 	}
222 
223 	/**
224 	 * {@inheritDoc}
225 	 */
226 	public E remove(final int index)
227 	{
228 		return list.remove(index);
229 	}
230 
231 	/**
232 	 * {@inheritDoc}
233 	 */
234 	public boolean remove(final Object o)
235 	{
236 		return list.remove(o);
237 	}
238 
239 	/**
240 	 * {@inheritDoc}
241 	 */
242 	public boolean removeAll(final Collection< ? > c)
243 	{
244 		return list.removeAll(c);
245 	}
246 
247 	/**
248 	 * {@inheritDoc}
249 	 */
250 	public boolean retainAll(final Collection< ? > c)
251 	{
252 		return list.retainAll(c);
253 	}
254 
255 	/**
256 	 * {@inheritDoc}
257 	 */
258 	public E set(final int index, final E element)
259 	{
260 		final int elementIndex = list.indexOf(element);
261 
262 		if (elementIndex == index) return element;
263 
264 		if (elementIndex == -1) return list.set(index, element);
265 		if (elementIndex > index)
266 		{
267 			list.remove(element);
268 			return list.set(index, element);
269 		}
270 
271 		// if (elementIndex < index)
272 		list.remove(element);
273 		return list.set(index - 1, element);
274 	}
275 
276 	/**
277 	 * {@inheritDoc}
278 	 */
279 	public int size()
280 	{
281 		return list.size();
282 	}
283 
284 	/**
285 	 * {@inheritDoc}
286 	 */
287 	public List<E> subList(final int fromIndex, final int toIndex)
288 	{
289 		return list.subList(fromIndex, toIndex);
290 	}
291 
292 	/**
293 	 * {@inheritDoc}
294 	 */
295 	public Object[] toArray()
296 	{
297 		return list.toArray();
298 	}
299 
300 	/**
301 	 * {@inheritDoc}
302 	 */
303 	public <T> T[] toArray(final T[] a)
304 	{
305 		return list.toArray(a);
306 	}
307 
308 	/**
309 	 * {@inheritDoc}
310 	 */
311 	@Override
312 	public String toString()
313 	{
314 		return list.toString();
315 	}
316 }
